messages: 3c6e0b8a9c15224a8228b9a98ca1531d (02:31): http://gsnedders.html5.org/outliner/process.py is failing, does anyone know of another outliner?
3c6e0b8a9c15224a8228b9a98ca1531d (03:17): so i have an outline done, will you look at it?
7a205621b91e4878465075e964d2b1e8 (03:23): 3c6e0b8a9c15224a8228b9a98ca1531d: they can, but they don't need to
3c6e0b8a9c15224a8228b9a98ca1531d (03:25): does that look like a good outline?

7a205621b91e4878465075e964d2b1e8 (03:43): 3c6e0b8a9c15224a8228b9a98ca1531d: looks good! The spec is not wrong. On that same page you showed me, a few scrolls up, it explains that sections can contain footers if you need them
3c6e0b8a9c15224a8228b9a98ca1531d (03:51): thanks for checking it out btw
3c6e0b8a9c15224a8228b9a98ca1531d (03:55): 7a205621b91e4878465075e964d2b1e8: don't you think i should have a <p> around Content?
7a205621b91e4878465075e964d2b1e8 (03:56): You should wrap your content as you see fit. I try to use a combination of block and inline elements so that it works in my favor laying out the page.
7a205621b91e4878465075e964d2b1e8 (03:57): I also wrap text into some tag, makes it easier to access it using js
3c6e0b8a9c15224a8228b9a98ca1531d (04:01): 7a205621b91e4878465075e964d2b1e8, what are the first css things i should start doing?
3c6e0b8a9c15224a8228b9a98ca1531d (04:01): eg, i want to set the body bg
7a205621b91e4878465075e964d2b1e8 (04:06): to set the background color of a page, give the html and body tags a background-color value
7a205621b91e4878465075e964d2b1e8 (04:06): 3c6e0b8a9c15224a8228b9a98ca1531d: start by placing everything where you want it. That'll give you plenty to do
3c6e0b8a9c15224a8228b9a98ca1531d (04:07): but i need to also use colors, because i don't use a border on everything
3c6e0b8a9c15224a8228b9a98ca1531d (04:07): sometimes just fills via bg colors
3c6e0b8a9c15224a8228b9a98ca1531d (04:12): well what do you mean by position things?
7a205621b91e4878465075e964d2b1e8 (04:14): making sure the header is at the top, the footer at the bottom, and if you have collumns set them where you want them
3c6e0b8a9c15224a8228b9a98ca1531d (04:19): footer doens't have to be at the bottom only
7a205621b91e4878465075e964d2b1e8 (04:21): no, but since is name after a foot, and feet usually go in the bottom, you might want to keep it that way :-)
3c6e0b8a9c15224a8228b9a98ca1531d (04:22): i thought so too until i saw a 'back to index' footer at the top and bottom of a page; made sense
3c6e0b8a9c15224a8228b9a98ca1531d (04:31): yea i'd agree, but i can see how they were using it
3c6e0b8a9c15224a8228b9a98ca1531d (04:32): a link back to index is a footer'ish kind of tool
3c6e0b8a9c15224a8228b9a98ca1531d (04:32): whereas on header typically you'd have intro material; title etc
3c6e0b8a9c15224a8228b9a98ca1531d (04:32): you could even put header'ish stuff on the bottom, and footer'ish stuff on the top
3c6e0b8a9c15224a8228b9a98ca1531d (04:32): depending on the user interaction paradigm you were thinking via
